intro: Galium pumilum subsp. marchandii, commonly known as the dwarf bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to certain regions of Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of diverse ecosystems where it contributes to soil stabilization and provides habitat for various insects.
